meanings.definition: To prove or show something to be true or genuine.
meanings.sent1: I need to authenticate my identity before accessing the secure building.
meanings.sent2: The signature on the document will authenticate its validity.
meanings.sent3: Trying to authenticate a fake painting can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to authenticate her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The fingerprint scan is used to authenticate users and ensure security.

meanings.definition: To confirm the validity or legitimacy of something.
meanings.sent1: Please authenticate the authenticity of the antique vase.
meanings.sent2: The notary will authenticate the legal document.
meanings.sent3: It's important to authenticate the ingredients before using them in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph helped authenticate the historical event.
meanings.sent5: The stamp on the letter is used to authenticate its origin.

meanings.definition: To verify the identity or authority of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The security guard needs to authenticate your access to the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The password is required to authenticate your account.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to authenticate the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The badge will authenticate your status as a staff member.
meanings.sent5: The official seal is used to authenticate important documents.
